content:
Using the word "SHIVERS" as a mnemonic for recognizing the symptoms of serotonin syndrome:

S - Shivering: Involuntary muscle tremors or shivering
H - Hyperreflexia: Over-responsive or overactive reflexes
I - Increased temperature: Elevated body temperature (hyperthermia)
V - Vital sign instability: Fluctuations in blood pressure, heart rate, and respiratory rate (autonomic instability)
E - Encephalopathy: Altered mental status, such as agitation, confusion, or hallucinations
R - Restlessness: Agitation and restlessness, inability to remain still
S - Sweating: Excessive sweating (diaphoresis)

This mnemonic can help healthcare professionals and patients remember the key symptoms of serotonin syndrome. If any of these symptoms are present in a patient taking serotonergic medications, it is essential to seek immediate medical attention.
